meanings.definition: A shop or store selling fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent1: I bought some greengroceries from the market.
meanings.sent2: The greengroceries on display looked vibrant and fresh.
meanings.sent3: The greengroceries at the store were so colorful, they made me want to eat a rainbow!
meanings.sent4: Her kitchen was like a greengroceries, filled with all the colors of nature.
meanings.sent5: The smell of greengroceries always reminds me of summer days.

meanings.definition: The business of selling fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent1: She decided to start her own greengroceries and promote healthy eating.
meanings.sent2: The greengroceries industry plays a vital role in providing nutritious food to the community.
meanings.sent3: The greengroceries business was booming, with customers lining up for their daily dose of vitamins.
meanings.sent4: In a world of fast food, her greengroceries venture stood out like a beacon of health.
meanings.sent5: The success of her greengroceries was a testament to the growing interest in organic produce.

meanings.definition: Fresh fruits and vegetables sold as a commodity.
meanings.sent1: The greengroceries at the market were priced reasonably.
meanings.sent2: He invested in greengroceries as he saw the potential for profit in the market.
meanings.sent3: The greengroceries were like little treasures waiting to be discovered in the bustling city.
meanings.sent4: She treated the greengroceries like precious gems, carefully selecting each piece.
meanings.sent5: The greengroceries gleamed under the market lights, enticing shoppers with their freshness.
